title: Drawing, "Design for a Tapestry: Africa", 1650–80
medium: Brush and brown ink, black wash, white gouache,over black chalk on laid paper. Framing lines in pen and black ink.
provenance: From the Collection of Leon Decloux.
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: A central group of women are flanked at left by a river god and at right by three figures.  The Queen of Africa, crowned with ostrich feathers is shown seated holding a mace. At her right stands a woman who carries a sheaf of grain with her left arm and holds aloft a feather or offering with her raised right hand. She wears the head of an elephant as a headdress; a lion accompanies her. A third woman is seated beside the Queen and looks toward her while pointing to the left.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for a Tapestry: Africa", 1650–80. Brush and brown ink, black wash, white gouache,over black chalk on laid paper. Framing lines in pen and black ink.. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-409.
